newsitem.title: UK: UK's Blair says Charles can wed Camilla - report.
newsitem.headline: UK's Blair says Charles can wed Camilla - report.

text.p: British Prime Minister Tony Blair is ready to give government approval for royal heir Prince Charles to marry his lover Camilla Parker Bowles, the Sun newspaper reported.
But the prime minister's blessing will depend on the couple winning the support of the British people and the Church of England, the tabloid said in its Monday editions.
Charles has been taking steps to give Camilla greater public exposure as the woman in his life.
But many Britons blame her for the break-up of Charles's 15-year marriage to Princess Diana and say they could never accept Camilla, who is also divorced, as the next queen of England.
The Sun quoted a close friend of Blair as saying: "His instincts tell him that if Charles and Camilla wish to marry they sould be allowed to do so.
"But he would be pretty mindful of any church opposition."
As prime minister, Blair has sweeping powers to advise Queen Elizabeth over the succession to the throne.
He has made it clear that he has no sympathy with some Labour Party members who want to do away with the monarchy.
One of Blair's closest aides, Minister without Portfolio Peter Mandelson, has had talks with Charles, 48, Camilla, 50, and Diana, 36.
Camilla hit the headlines earlier this month when Charles hosted a glittering 50th birthday party for her at his country residence, Highgrove.
